member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.AsyncStreamCopier`1.StartCopyStream(System.Action{Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Executor.ExecutionState{`0}},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Begins a stream copy operation.
This method wraps the StartCopyStreamAsync method, presenting a different API for it. As we update the library to be more task-based, callers should gradually move to StartCopyStreamAsync.
member.param: Callback delegate
Number of bytes to copy from source stream to destination stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
Maximum length of the source stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
The cancellation token for the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.AsyncStreamCopier`1.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up references. To end a copy operation, call Cancel() on the ExecutionState.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.AsyncStreamCopier`1.StartCopyStreamAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This method performs the stream copy in an asynchronous, task-based manner.
To do the stream copy in a begin-with-callback style (the old style), use StartCopyStream, which wraps this method, does appropriate cancellation/exception handling, and calls the callback.
This method sets up cancellation, and will cancel if either the timeout on the execution state expires, or cancel() is called directly (on the ExecutionState).
This method does not set the ExceptionRef on the ExecutionState, or abort the request.
member.param: Number of bytes to copy from source stream to destination stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
Maximum length of the source stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
The cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A Task representing the asynchronous stream copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.AsyncStreamCopier`1.StartCopyStreamAsyncHelper(System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method does the actual internal logic of copying one stream to another.
member.param: Number of bytes to copy from source stream to destination stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
Maximum length of the source stream. Cannot pass in both copyLength and maxLength.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: A Task representing the asynchronous stream copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.NavigationHelper.GetContainerName(System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retrieves the container part of a storage Uri, or "$root" if the container is implicit.
member.param: The blob address.
If set to true use path style Uris.
member.returns: Name of the container.
member.remarks:
The trailing slash is always removed.
GetContainerName(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myfolder/myblob")) will return "mycontainer" GetContainerName(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/")) will return "mycontainer" GetContainerName(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/myblob")) will return "$root" GetContainerName(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/")) will throw ArgumentException

member.param: The blob address.
If set to true use path style Uris.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the blob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.NavigationHelper.GetShareName(System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retrieves the share part of a storage Uri, or "$root" if the share is implicit.
member.param: The file address.
If set to true use path style Uris.
member.returns: Name of the share.
member.remarks:
The trailing slash is always removed.
GetShareName(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/myshare/myfolder/myfile")) will return "myshare" GetShareName(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/myshare/")) will return "myshare" GetShareName(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/")) will throw ArgumentException

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Core.Util.NavigationHelper.GetBlobParentNameAndAddress(Microsoft.Azure.Storage.StorageUri,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String@,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.StorageUri@)
member.summary: Retrieves the parent name from a storage Uri.
member.param: The blob address.
The delimiter.
If set to true use path style Uris.
Name of the parent.
The parent URI.
member.returns: The name of the parent.
member.remarks: Adds the trailing delimiter as the prefix returned by the storage REST api always contains the delimiter.
member.example: GetBlobParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myfolder/myblob", "/")) will return "/myfolder/" GetBlobParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myfolder|myblob", "|") will return "/myfolder|" GetBlobParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob", "/") will return "" GetBlobParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/", "/") will return ""

member.returns: The name of the parent.

member.example: GetFileParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/myshare/myfolder/myfile", "/")) will return "myfolder" GetFileParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/myshare/myfile", "/") will return "" GetFileParentNameAndAddress(new Uri("http://test.file.core.windows.net/myshare/", "/") will return ""

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.DisableContentMD5Validation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that MD5 validation will be disabled when downloading blobs.
member.value: Use true to disable MD5 validation; false to enable MD5 validation. Default is false.
member.remarks:
When downloading a blob, if the value already exists on the blob, the Storage service will include the MD5 hash of the entire blob as a header. This option controls whether or not the Storage Client will validate that MD5 hash on download. See for more details.
## Examples [!code-csharp[Disable_Content_MD5_Validation_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_DisableContentMD5Validation "Disable Content MD5 Validation Sample")]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.StoreContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that an MD5 hash will be calculated and stored when uploading a blob.
member.value: Use true to calculate and store an MD5 hash when uploading a blob; otherwise, false. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: This property is not supported for the Append* APIs. The StoreBlobContentMD5 request option instructs the Storage Client to calculate the MD5 hash of the blob content during an upload operation. This value is then stored on the blob object as the Content-MD5 header. This option applies only to upload operations. This is useful for validating the integrity of the blob upon later download, and compatible with the Content-MD5 header as defined in the HTTP spec. If using the Storage Client for later download, if the Content-MD5 header is present, the MD5 hash of the content will be validated, unless "DisableContentMD5Validation" is set. Note that this value is not validated on the Azure Storage service on either upload or download of data; it is merely stored and returned. ## Examples [!code-csharp[Store_Blob_Content_MD5_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_StoreBlobContentMD5 "Store Blob Content MD5 Sample")]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.UseTransactionalMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to calculate and send/validate content MD5 for transactions.
member.value: Use true to calculate and send/validate content MD5 for transactions; otherwise, false. Default is false.
member.remarks: The UseTransactionalMD5 option instructs the Storage Client to calculate and validate the MD5 hash of individual Storage REST operations. For a given REST operation, if this value is set, both the Storage Client and the Storage service will calculate the MD5 hash of the transferred data, and will fail if the values do not match. This value is not persisted on the service or the client. This option applies to both upload and download operations. Note that HTTPS does a similar check during transit. If you are using HTTPS, we recommend this feature be off. ## Examples [!code-csharp[Use_Transactional_MD5_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_UseTransactionalMD5 "Use Transactional MD5 Sample")]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.DisableContentCRC64Validation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that CRC64 validation will be disabled when downloading blobs.
member.value: Use true to disable CRC64 validation; false to enable CRC64 validation. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.StoreContentCRC64
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that an CRC64 hash will be calculated and stored when uploading a blob.
member.value: Use true to calculate and store an CRC64 hash when uploading a blob; otherwise, false. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: This property is not supported for the Append* APIs. The StoreBlobContentCRC64 request option instructs the Storage Client to calculate the CRC64 hash of the blob content during an upload operation. This value is then stored on the blob object as the Content-CRC64 header. This option applies only to upload operations. This is useful for validating the integrity of the blob upon later download, and compatible with the Content-CRC64 header as defined in the HTTP spec. If using the Storage Client for later download, if the Content-CRC64 header is present, the CRC64 hash of the content will be validated, unless "DisableContentCRC64Validation" is set. Note that this value is not validated on the Azure Storage service on either upload or download of data; it is merely stored and returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Shared.Protocol.ChecksumOptions.UseTransactionalCRC64
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to calculate and send/validate content CRC64 for transactions.
member.value: Use true to calculate and send/validate content CRC64 for transactions; otherwise, false. Default is false.
member.remarks: The UseTransactionalCRC64 option instructs the Storage Client to calculate and validate the CRC64 hash of individual Storage REST operations. For a given REST operation, if this value is set, both the Storage Client and the Storage service will calculate the CRC64 hash of the transferred data, and will fail if the values do not match. This value is not persisted on the service or the client. This option applies to both upload and download operations. Note that HTTPS does a similar check during transit. If you are using HTTPS, we recommend this feature be off.

member.summary: Time for IfUnmodifiedSince.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfMatchETag
member.summary: Gets or sets an ETag value for a condition specifying that the given ETag must match the ETag of the specified resource.
member.value: A string containing an ETag value, or "*" to match any ETag. If null, no condition exists.

member.summary: Gets or sets an ETag value for a condition specifying that the given ETag must not match the ETag of the specified resource.
member.value: A string containing an ETag value, or "*" to match any ETag. If null, no condition exists.

member.summary: Gets or sets a CRC64 value for a condition speifying that the given CRC64 must match the CRC64 of the specified resource.
member.value: A string containing a CRC64 value. If null, no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfNoneMatchContentCrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a CRC64 value for a condition specifying that the given CRC64 must not match the CRC64 of the specified resource.
member.value: A string containing a CRC64 value. If null, no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfModifiedSinceTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying a time since which a resource has been modified.
member.value: A value specified in UTC, or null if no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfNotModifiedSinceTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying a time since which a resource has not been modified.
member.value: A value specified in UTC, or null if no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfMaxSizeLessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition that specifies the maximum size allowed for an append blob when a new block is committed. The append will succeed only if the size of the blob after the append operation is less than or equal to the specified size.
member.value: The maximum size in bytes, or null if no value is set.
member.remarks: This condition only applies to append blobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfAppendPositionEqual
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying the byte offset to check for when committing a block to an append blob. The append will succeed only if the end position is equal to this number.
member.value: An append position number, or null if no value is set.
member.remarks: This condition only applies to append blobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfSequenceNumberLessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying that the current sequence number must be less than or equal to the specified value.
member.value: A sequence number, or null if no condition exists.
member.remarks: This condition only applies to page blobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfSequenceNumberLessThan
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying that the current sequence number must be less than the specified value.
member.value: A sequence number, or null if no condition exists.
member.remarks: This condition only applies to page blobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IfSequenceNumberEqual
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a condition specifying that the current sequence number must be equal to the specified value.
member.value: A sequence number, or null if no condition exists.
member.remarks: This condition only applies to page blobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.LeaseId
member.summary: Gets or sets a lease ID that must match the lease on a resource.
member.value: A string containing a lease ID, or null if no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IsConditional
member.summary: Determines whether the access condition is one of the four conditional headers.
member.value: true if the access condition is a conditional header; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.IsIfNotExists
member.summary: Determines whether the access condition is IfNotExists.
member.value: true if the access condition is a IfNotExists; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Remove the IfNotExists condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfExistsCondition

member.returns: An object that represents a condition where a resource exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfMatchCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource's ETag value matches the specified ETag value.
member.param: The ETag value to check against the resource's ETag.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Match condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfModifiedSinceCondition(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.
member.param: A value specifying the time since which the resource must have been modified.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Modified-Since condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfNoneMatchCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource's ETag value does not match the specified ETag value.
member.param: The ETag value to check against the resource's ETag, or "*" to require that the resource does not exist.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-None-Match condition.
member.remarks: If "*" is specified for the parameter, then this condition requires that the resource does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfNotModifiedSinceCondition(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource has not been modified since the specified time.
member.param: A value specifying the time since which the resource must not have been modified.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Unmodified-Since condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfMaxSizeLessThanOrEqualCondition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the size of the append blob after committing the block is less than or equal to the specified value.
member.param: An integer specifying the maximum allowed size of the blob, in bytes, when committing a new block.
member.returns: An object that represents the maximum allowed size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfAppendPositionEqualCondition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the end position of the append blob is equal to the specified value.
member.param: An integer specifying the offset to compare to the current end position of the blob.
member.returns: An object that represents the offset to compare.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfSequenceNumberLessThanOrEqualCondition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if resource's current sequence number is less than or equal to the specified value.
member.param: The value to compare to the current sequence number.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Sequence-Number-LE condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfSequenceNumberLessThanCondition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if resource's current sequence number is less than the specified value.
member.param: The value to compare to the current sequence number.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Sequence-Number-LT condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateIfSequenceNumberEqualCondition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if resource's current sequence number is equal to the specified value.
member.param: The value to compare to the current sequence number.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Sequence-Number-EQ condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.GenerateLeaseCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the lease ID on the resource matches the specified lease ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition.CloneConditionWithETag(Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource's ETag value matches the specified ETag value and the lease ID on the resource matches the lease ID specified in the given access condition.
member.param: An object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed.
The ETag value that must be matched.
member.returns: An object that represents the If-Match and the lease conditions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.RetryPolicies.LocationMode.PrimaryThenSecondary
member.summary: Requests are always sent to the primary location first. If a request fails, it is sent to the secondary location.
member.remarks: If this value is used for requests that are only valid against one location, the client will only target the allowed location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.RetryPolicies.LocationMode.SecondaryOnly
member.summary: Requests are always sent to the secondary location.
member.remarks: If this value is used for requests that only work against a primary location (create, modify, and delete APIs), the request will fail in the client.

member.summary: Requests are always sent to the secondary location first. If a request fails, it is sent to the primary location.
member.remarks: If this value is used for requests that are only valid against one location, the client will only target the allowed location.
